title: Website designer
description: Overall Theme and Feel: Therapeutic and Invigorating: The design should evoke a sense of calm, wellness, and rejuvenation, reflecting the therapeutic nature of your towels. Using a soothing color palette of greens and whites, as you've mentioned, would create a refreshing and clean look. Minimalistic and Modern: A clean, uncluttered layout with plenty of white space will help to convey the luxury and simplicity of your product. 2. Color Scheme: Primary Colors: Green and white. Use different shades of green for accents, such as buttons, headings, and call-to-action sections, while maintaining white as the background color to keep the overall look clean and fresh. Secondary Colors: Soft gray and earthy tones. These can be used for text, borders, or subtle backgrounds to add depth without overpowering the primary color scheme. 3. Typography: Font Style: Use a clean, modern sans-serif font for body text (e.g., Lato or Open Sans) to ensure readability. For headings and titles, consider a slightly bolder or more elegant font (e.g., Montserrat or Raleway) to create a contrast. Font Size: Ensure the font size is large enough for easy reading, especially for the 50+ age group. Headings should stand out, while body text should be comfortable to read. 4. Layout: Header: Include a logo (simple and elegant, possibly using green and white), navigation menu, and a call-to-action button (e.g., "Shop Now" or "Learn More"). The header should be sticky, so it remains visible as users scroll down. Hero Section: A large, high-quality image of your Invigor towels, showing their luxurious texture and design. Overlay a tagline that captures the essence of your product, such as "Rejuvenate Your Skin with Every Use." Include a prominent call-to-action button here. Product Highlights: A section dedicated to showcasing the unique features of the Invigor towels, such as the patented design, non-exfoliating benefits, and use of bamboo viscose. Use icons and short descriptions for easy understanding. About Section: Share your story, highlighting the journey from your family's bookstore to developing a new path in skincare. Include a personal touch by mentioning your interest in NK Killer cells and skincare. Use images and a brief narrative to engage visitors. Product Display: A clean, grid-style display of your towels, each with a high-quality image, brief description, and price. Include a "Buy Now" or "Add to Cart" button for each product. Use hover effects to highlight products when users move their cursor over them. Testimonials: Showcase customer reviews or testimonials to build trust and credibility. Use quotes and images if available to make this section more relatable. Blog Section: Include a section for blog posts where you can share insights about skincare, the benefits of your products, and tips for maintaining healthy skin. This can also help with SEO and engaging your audience. Footer: Include contact information, social media links, a newsletter signup form, and quick links to important pages like About, Shop, Blog, and Contact Us. Use a dark background with white text to differentiate the footer from the rest of the page. 5. User Experience: Responsive Design: Ensure the website is mobile-friendly and looks great on all devices, as many users will access it from smartphones or tablets. Fast Loading: Optimize images and use efficient coding practices to ensure the site loads quickly, enhancing user experience and SEO. Easy Navigation: The site should be easy to navigate, with a clear menu structure and well-organized content. Use breadcrumbs and a search function to help users find what they're looking for. 6. Additional Features: E-commerce Functionality: Integrate a secure shopping cart and checkout system, with multiple payment options available. Consider using WooCommerce for to manage products, orders, and customer data efficiently. SEO Optimization: Use SEO best practices, such as optimizing meta tags, alt text for images, and content keywords, to help your site rank better in search engines. Analytics Integration: Set up Google Analytics to track user behavior, sales, and other key metrics to make informed decisions about marketing and website improvements. This design approach will help create a professional, user-friendly website that effectively showcases the Invigor towels and engages visitors, encouraging them to explore your products and make a purchase.

title: Wildlife Conservation NGO Website Design
description: Greetings Upwork Applicants, We are an international 501c3 non-profit known as S.P.E.C.I.E.S. we engage in the preservation of our planet's wild carnivores, and the communities of people that live alongside them in 18 countries and growing via community projects, and scientific research. Our current website (carnivores.org) is quite out of date, and we are looking for a web designer that can bring S.P.E.C.I.E.S. into the modern era of web design, and help us increase our brand visibility with a completely new website that can take our users on a visual albeit informative journey following our teams work in and out of the field, and the stories of these species themselves; as well as market our upcoming wildlife tourism programme to potential clients in a way that is bespoke, and the S.P.E.C.I.E.S. brand stands out from other sites in our community. Here are some sample websites of similar organisations that we feel match the visual direction we would like to go with this project: https://www.sealegacy.org https://www.safaridrive.com https://www.thornybush.com https://ewt.org.za https://www.nationalgeographic.com/expeditions/ https://www.africanparks.org https://www.londolozi.com Thank you very much for your time, and helping us bring our work into the spotlight. Cheers and thanks, The S.P.E.C.I.E.S. team

title: NEW WordPress Landing Page Needed with Elegant, Upscale Cosmetics & Animation
description: In this video below, I have two rough demos for my new landing page, that were created by a previous developer. I am looking for someone to create a NEW landing page, starting from scratch, that follows my instruction in this video below. Unfortunately, neither of these two demos that you see in the video is ideal for a finished product, so I am seeking a new designer to start FROM SCRATCH using these ideas and instructions. I outline what I need in this video, citing the good and bad. I'll also have more content to provide for you: https://somup.com/cZjtrYmexv I’ll give you this photo of myself. I also have the logos for my colleges to go with the animation, but please note these two important things: (1) You'll probably need to modify these logos that I give you, like the previous designer did, because they are all different sizes and shapes. Please factor this into your estimate and our discussions. (2) I need to ENSURE that the animation can be seen upon page load on all devices. This previous designed didn't know how to make the animation and homepage viewable on all devices, so the problem I had is that the end user would not actually see the animation take place without scrolling down. The animation/logos simply MUST be present upon load withOUT scrolling down to see it. It has to be eye-level. It all takes place over about 2+ seconds, so obviously, no one has time to scroll down to see it anyway. Your reply should ONLY contain the following: 1. Begin your message with "I READ IT ALL" so I know you did so. 2. Replicate this animation (use whatever logos you have, I just need to see that you can do this properly) on multiple screens, different sizes, etc, so I know that this time, I won;t get stuck with a designer who wastes my time. If the animation won;t be at eye level on all major devices, then we're wasting time as I will not complete the order/contract.

title: Expert Developer Needed: WP Engine Atlas, Faust.js, ChakraUI, and GraphQL
description: I am seeking an experienced developer with expertise in the following specific tech stack: WP Engine Atlas Faust.js ChakraUI WordPress plugins GraphQL Key Requirements: Proven experience with WP Engine Atlas and headless development Strong proficiency in Faust.js for building front-end applications Expertise in ChakraUI for creating responsive and accessible user interfaces In-depth knowledge of GraphQL for efficient data querying Familiarity with plugins and their integration in a headless setup Additional Skills: Excellent problem-solving abilities Strong communication skills Self-motivated and able to work independently Ability to tackle complex issues without constant guidance Responsibilities: Troubleshoot and resolve issues within our existing codebase Implement new features and optimizations Ensure seamless integration between the headless backend and Faust.js frontend Understand GraphQL queries for improved performance Collaborate with team members to maintain and enhance the project The ideal candidate will have a track record of successfully working with this specific tech stack and be able to demonstrate their expertise through previous projects or code samples. I seek someone who can hit the ground running and contribute effectively to our project without requiring extensive training or hand-holding. If you have the required skills and experience, please apply with your portfolio and any relevant examples of your work with WP Engine Atlas, Faust.js, and headless development.
